com.kontakt.sdk.android.factory

Class Filters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.android.factory.Filters

  • public final class Filters
extends Object
    Filters are designed to enable more detailed Beacons search. We decided to include this feature as Android L supports filtering as well. Technically, filters work as mask matchers for specific byte sequences in advertising package. There are several predefined filters including:
    • Proximity UUID filter - accepts devices only with desired Proximity UUID
    • Beacon Unique ID filter - every kontakt Beacon has assigned Unique Id to itself. What is more this Unique Id may be read in Service Data in the Advertising Package. Thus, filtering by this property is enabled as well. Please note that this filter works well only for Beacons produces by Kontakt.
    • Device Name filter - accepts only devices named as specified during filter creation and inclusion to BeaconManager configuration
    • Address filter - accepts only devices with matching MAC Address
    • Firmware filter - accepts only devices with specified version of firmware version. Please note that this filter works well only with Kontakt beacons
    • Major filter - accepts only devices with specified major value
    • Minor filter - accepts only devices with specified minor value
    • Multi filter - accepts only devices with specified batch of parameters including: device name, proximity UUID, MAC address, unique Id, firmware
    • Custom filter - this filter is introduced to perform custom filtering. Despite the fact that other filters should meet your needs, you have possibility to create your own filter.
    In Android version lower than Build.VERSION_CODES.LOLLIPOP filters are included the form as they are specified. For the latest one and further the filters are converted to ScanFilters and passed to handle by the framework.
